# Getting Started Making Music

There are four elements of formula you need to make music.

Here, you will see we create a music from the first layer (drums), and then adding more layers to complete the music.

We will deep dive into each section later.

## 1. Drums

Start with learning **drums**. Drums define the rhythm and groove of your track. They set the foundation for everything else: tempo, energy, and movement. Even a simple beat can bring life to a melody.

[https://strudel.cc/#cygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIp](https://strudel.cc/#cygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIp)

**bd** is bass drum (also called kick-drums),

**sd** is snare drum. **RolandTR909** is the name of the sound.

You can try changing **RolandTR909** to **AkaiLinn, RhythmAce, RolandTR808, ViscoSpaceDrum** and see how it sounds.

Practice layering kicks, snares, and hi-hats (**hh**) to understand how rhythm interacts with space. Once you can make a solid drum pattern, the rest of your music will naturally fall into place.

[https://strudel.cc/#](https://strudel.cc/#)

This is an example how you can stack the kick/snare pattern with hi-hats.
You might want to lower the volume of the hats with **.gain(0.3)** so it fits nicely into the mix.

## 2. Bass

A bass in music usually refers to the **low-pitched notes or instruments that provide the foundation of harmony and rhythm**. Its main role is to support the drums and chords, giving music depth, weight, and groove.

Instruments: bass guitar, synthesizer, upright bass, low notes on piano, or even using sampled sounds.

A **bassline** is the sequence of bass notes in a song. A bassline gives your loop a melodic foundation.

This is an example of a bassline, notice that they are low-pitched notes.

[https://strudel.cc/#bm90ZSgiYzIgfiBjMiB%2BIGUyIH4gZzEgfiIp](https://strudel.cc/#bm90ZSgiYzIgfiBjMiB%2BIGUyIH4gZzEgfiIp)

This is how we incorporate bass-line on top of our drums we created before

[https://strudel.cc/#Ly8gMS4gRGVmaW5lIHRoZSBkcnVtIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGRydW1zID0gcygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAyLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGhpLWhhdCBsYXllcgpjb25zdCBoYXRzID0gcygiaGgqOCIpLmdhaW4oMC4zKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAzLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGJhc3NsaW5lIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGJhc3MgPSBub3RlKCJjMiB%2BIGMyIH4gZTIgfiBnMSB%2BIikKICAuc291bmQoInNhd3Rvb3RoIikKICAubHBmKDUwMCkKICAubHBxKDMpCiAgLmRlbGF5KDAuNSkKICAuZGVsYXl0aW1lKCIwLjI1IDAuNSIpCgoKLy8gNC4gU3RhY2sgYWxsIHRoZSBsYXllcnMgdG8gcGxheSB0aGVtIGF0IG9uY2UKc3RhY2soZHJ1bXMsIGhhdHMsIGJhc3Mp](https://strudel.cc/#Ly8gMS4gRGVmaW5lIHRoZSBkcnVtIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGRydW1zID0gcygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAyLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGhpLWhhdCBsYXllcgpjb25zdCBoYXRzID0gcygiaGgqOCIpLmdhaW4oMC4zKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAzLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGJhc3NsaW5lIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGJhc3MgPSBub3RlKCJjMiB%2BIGMyIH4gZTIgfiBnMSB%2BIikKICAuc291bmQoInNhd3Rvb3RoIikKICAubHBmKDUwMCkKICAubHBxKDMpCiAgLmRlbGF5KDAuNSkKICAuZGVsYXl0aW1lKCIwLjI1IDAuNSIpCgoKLy8gNC4gU3RhY2sgYWxsIHRoZSBsYXllcnMgdG8gcGxheSB0aGVtIGF0IG9uY2UKc3RhY2soZHJ1bXMsIGhhdHMsIGJhc3Mp)

There are lots of effects here, don’t worry we will dive into that later.

## 3. Chords

Chords give emotion and color. They define the mood of your song, whether it feels happy, sad, mysterious, or uplifting. You do not need to know complex music theory to start. Begin with simple triads and progressions like C–G–Am–F.

[https://strudel.cc/#bm90ZSgiYzQgZTQgZzQgYzUiKS5zb3VuZCgidHJpYW5nbGUiKQ%3D%3D](https://strudel.cc/#bm90ZSgiYzQgZTQgZzQgYzUiKS5zb3VuZCgidHJpYW5nbGUiKQ%3D%3D)

Once you understand how chords move, you will unlock endless possibilities for songwriting and arrangement.

Let’s see what happens if we add chords to our music

[https://strudel.cc/#Ly8gMS4gRGVmaW5lIHRoZSBkcnVtIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGRydW1zID0gcygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAyLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGhpLWhhdCBsYXllcgpjb25zdCBoYXRzID0gcygiaGgqOCIpLmdhaW4oMC4zKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAzLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGJhc3NsaW5lIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGJhc3MgPSBub3RlKCJjMiB%2BIGMyIH4gZTIgfiBnMSB%%3D](https://strudel.cc/#Ly8gMS4gRGVmaW5lIHRoZSBkcnVtIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGRydW1zID0gcygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAyLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGhpLWhhdCBsYXllcgpjb25zdCBoYXRzID0gcygiaGgqOCIpLmdhaW4oMC4zKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAzLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGJhc3NsaW5lIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGJhc3MgPSBub3RlKCJjMiB%2BIGMyIH4gZTIgfiBnMSB%%3D)

## 4. Melodies

Melody is the voice of your song. It is what listeners remember and hum later. It can come from vocals, lead synths, guitars, or even sampled instruments. A strong melody usually plays within the scale of your chords but adds small variations to stand out. Keep it simple, repeat key phrases, and do not be afraid to leave space, as silence can make your melody hit harder.

Let’s add melodies to our music and here’s our full music:

[https://strudel.cc/#Ly8gMS4gRGVmaW5lIHRoZSBkcnVtIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGRydW1zID0gcygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAyLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGhpLWhhdCBsYXllcgpjb25zdCBoYXRzID0gcygiaGgqOCIpLmdhaW4oMC4zKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAzLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGJhc3NsaW5lIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGJhc3MgPSBub3RlKCJjMiB%2BIGMyIH4gZTIgfiBnMSB%%3D](https://strudel.cc/#Ly8gMS4gRGVmaW5lIHRoZSBkcnVtIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGRydW1zID0gcygiYmQgc2QgYmQgc2QiKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAyLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGhpLWhhdCBsYXllcgpjb25zdCBoYXRzID0gcygiaGgqOCIpLmdhaW4oMC4zKS5iYW5rKCJSb2xhbmRUUjkwOSIpCgovLyAzLiBEZWZpbmUgdGhlIGJhc3NsaW5lIGxheWVyCmNvbnN0IGJhc3MgPSBub3RlKCJjMiB%2BIGMyIH4gZTIgfiBnMSB%%3D)
